entry.title: Re: **Subject:** How to keep Invoice Request in "To Be In...
entry.content: Dear Adie, Thank you for your response and the KBA references. I tested by removing `SettlementPriorityCode` as suggested in KBA 2389023. The Invoice Request was successfully created in "To Be Invoiced" status without creating a Customer Invoice. Also, Credit Memo creation works correctly using `ReceivablesPropertyMovementDirectionCode=1`. However, **the Invoice Request created via web service is read-only in the UI.** I cannot edit any fields including discount percentage. **Background:** We have an open case regarding a known issue where discount percentages are not applied correctly when creating Invoice Requests with Text items (without Product or Service specification) via web service. As a workaround, we were considering creating the Invoice Request via API and then manually adding the discount in the UI before invoice creation. **Question:** Is there a way to create an editable Invoice Request via web service that stays in "To Be Invoiced" status? Or must we use a two-step API approach (create, then update via web service)? Thank you for your assistance. Best regards

entry.title: Re: Joining form task in onboarding is not getting assign...
entry.content:
Hello @muqeet_mster ,
The error pop up might be appearing because the custom object associated with the task might be non-secured. In the permission role under Metadata Framework > Admin Access to non-secured objects should be enabled. 
If this is a secured object, please grant the necessary permission based on the permission category. 
Additionally, Custom Task and Custom Task Definition should be granted under Onboarding or Offboarding Object Permissions. 
Lastly, you need to validate the assignment group for these permissions. If the assignment group (target population) is invalid, you will see such error messages.

entry.title: Re: **Subject:** How to keep Invoice Request in "To Be In...
entry.content: Dear Adie, Thank you for the KBA references. I tested the suggestions, and while I successfully created an Invoice Request in "To Be Invoiced" status by omitting `SettlementPriorityCode`, I discovered the Invoice Request is read-only in the UI. I then attempted a **two-step API approach** (create with actionCode="01", then update with actionCode="02") to add discount percentage after creation. Unfortunately, **this also failed for Text items**. **Test Summary:** **Step 1:** Created Invoice Request with actionCode="01" (no discount) - Result: Invoice Request created successfully in "To Be Invoiced" status - Discount field: Empty **Step 2:** Updated same Invoice Request with actionCode="02", adding discount via PriceComponent TypeCode 7PR6 - Result: Update returned success (no error), but discount still shows 0% in UI **XML snippet for Step 2 (Update):** ```xml <CustomerInvoiceRequest actionCode="02"> <BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID>INVOICE_REQUEST_ID</BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID> <Item> <PriceAndTax> <PriceComponent> <TypeCode>7PR1</TypeCode> <Rate> <DecimalValue>200000</DecimalValue> <CurrencyCode>KRW</CurrencyCode> <BaseDecimalValue>1</BaseDecimalValue> <BaseMeasureUnitCode>EA</BaseMeasureUnitCode> </Rate> </PriceComponent> <PriceComponent> <TypeCode>7PR6</TypeCode> <Rate> <DecimalValue>40</DecimalValue> </Rate> </PriceComponent> </PriceAndTax> </Item> </CustomerInvoiceRequest> ``` The discount percentage is silently ignored even in the update operation for Text items (items without Product or Service specification). **Question:** Is there any other approach to successfully apply discount percentages to Text items via web service? Both single-step and two-step approaches have failed. Thank you for your assistance.

entry.title: Re: ONB_ Crossboarding triggering in both ONB1.0 and ONB2...
entry.content:
Hello @DiviaRadhakrishnan ,
Typically, the rule with scenario "Initiate Internal Hire Configuration" is used to triggered candidates via Onboarding 2.0
Along with this, system will evaluate the configuration maintained in Onboarding Integration Setup and Onboarding 1.0 Integration Setup. If both the conditions are in favour to not trigger the crossboarding process for 1.0, yet the candidate is created in onboarding 1.0, I would recommend creating a ticket for this issue.

entry.title: Re: IBP statistical forecasting in specified UOM
entry.content:
Hi Jez,

This is the common practice we are following:

1. we add a new UOM to UOM Master data as " 1BU" (1 Base Unit)

2. we add the conversion factor for each product and  1BU as 1.

This way we you can get the History KF get converted to 1BU in KF calculation through standard UOM conversion technique. Same with your Statistical Forecast KF.

Now you can run the forecast at 1BU level, which has conversion to m2 as well as pieces as 1. 

Hope I answered your question.

Thanks

Rahul Mohnot

entry.title: Re: Crossboarding trigger from EC and Recruitment
entry.content:
Hello @harinich ,
#1
The internal hire might be missing permissions from permission categories such as Employee Views, Employee Central Effective Dated Entities and Employee Data. Kindly add these permissions to any Employee Self Service Role, the page will load with the details as expected. 
#2
Crossboarding candidates initiated from RCM will only appear in the dashboard when the rule associated with EVENT TRANSFER and Initiate Internal Recruit Configuration (scenario) is successfully evaluated to true. If any of the rules are not evaluated to true, crossboarding process will not be created in onboarding.

entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: Early Preview of SAP for Internal Controls, Compliance and Risk Management Conference
entry.content:
After visiting Dublin, Copenhagen, Brussels, and Budapest, we continue our European tour with the SAP for Internal Control, Compliance and Risk Management Conference.

Next year, we‚Äôll be back to the origin of this conference, in Amsterdam. If you were with us in 2018 and 2023, then this will bring back some fond memories!

During the first installation of the conference in Amsterdam in 2018, most of the discussions related to control automation and especially regarding GDPR. But things have definitely changed.

Although automation is still central to this conference, companies have started to break down compliance silos, and the 2026 theme of the conference reflects this broader approach:  Driving Compliance, Managing Risk, Building Trust.

But what hasn‚Äôt changed is the continuous support from partners, the insightful customer sessions and the networking event, which have gotten more compelling every year!

 

New Trends and Topics Discussed

 

The alignment of IT Risk and Cybersecurity with the wider Enterprise Risk and Compliance framework is a process that started some time ago and will still be core to the discussions in Amsterdam, additional trends will also be at the heart of the presentations. Including how to adapt faster and more effortlessly with ever changing regulatory requirements with a delicate balance of intelligent automation and artificial intelligence to achieve compliance.

Additional ‚Äúhot topics‚Äù will include:

 

Business AI

  • Automatically monitor and analyse regulatory changes
  • Detecting unusual patterns or behaviors
  • Automating the auditing process by analysing large volumes of data

 

Enterprise Risk and Compliance

  • Controlling key processes and compliance
  • Monitoring risks and the adequacy of your controls
  • Detecting fraud and investigating suspicious patterns faster

 

Cybersecurity and Data Protection

  • Neutralising cyberattacks before they cause damage
  • Simplifying the analysis of suspicious activities and detecting security gaps
  • Safeguarding the operation of SAP applications

 

Identity and Access Governance

  • Detecting and remediating access risk violations
  • Simplifying access management in complex environments
  • Managing user access in heterogeneous environments

 

RISE with SAP

  • Improving collaboration and mobility
  • Achieving faster time to value
  • Simplifying your transformation journey

 

Is this Conference for Me?

 

Quick hint: if you are reading this blog, then chances are that yes, this conference is 100% for you!

If you already are a user of SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance for enterprise risk and compliance, identity and access governance or cybersecurity and data protection, and are looking to learn and do more, then this conference will provide you with an update on new features released but also innovative case studies and partner tips.

If you are new to the world of SAP and want to learn how others are gaining competitive advantage and staying one step ahead, then this conference will help you discover how your team can accurately and continuously monitor risks, identities, cyberthreats, and compliance across your mission-critical systems and processes.

Finally, if you would like to meet your peers to exchange best practices and expand your professional network for future development, then do join us!

 

Free Pre-Conference Webinar

 

If you haven‚Äôt attended a SAP for Internal Controls, Compliance and Risk Management Conference and are still not sure whether this is the right one for you, then have a look at our free pre-conference webinar from October where speakers from SAP, partners, and customers shared updates on the latest innovations and developments in SAP‚Äôs Governance, Risk, and Compliance solutions but also insights into what‚Äôs planned for the in-person event.

You will be able to view the recording here: Webinar - TAC Insights: Business Events & Networking

 

50 Words Summary

 

  • What: only event designed to bring together the ecosystem of SAP users, partners and solution experts to address SAP‚Äôs GRC and cyber security portfolio in a business-centric context
  • Where: Novotel Amsterdam City Hotel
  • When: March 3 - 4, 2026
  • What: have a look at the Agenda page - it will be updated as more sessions are confirmed
  • How: Registration page ‚Äì and additional bonus: there is an Early bird rate running until December 31st 2025!

And if you are interested in learning more about SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance, feel free to fill-in the demo request form!

entry.title: An Introduction to FI-CA in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Simplifying High-Volume Financial Operations
entry.content:
Rajesh, a payment processing specialist at a leading telecom company, starts his day drowning in spreadsheets and bank files. Millions of transactions wait for manual reconciliation, and every missed match means a frustrated customer and a delayed month-end close.

But what if Rajesh could automate 90% of his work?
With FI-CA in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, his world changes:

  • AI-powered payment matching clears payments overnight.
  • Real-time postings to the Universal Journal eliminate manual entries.
  • Embedded analytics give him instant visibility into cash flow

This blog explores how FI-CA simplifies high-volume financial operations, why it‚Äôs a game-changer for industries like telecom and utilities, and how businesses can leverage cloud agility and automation to stay ahead.


This blog explores how FI-CA simplifies high-volume financial operations, why it‚Äôs a game-changer for industries like telecom and utilities, and how businesses can leverage cloud agility and automation to stay ahead.

What is FI-CA?

Financial Contract Accounting (FI-CA) is SAP‚Äôs specialized subledger designed for industries that handle high-volume, low-value transactions‚Äîsuch as utilities, telecom, insurance, and subscription-based businesses. Unlike traditional FI-AR, FI-CA offers mass processing capabilities, flexible payment handling, and integration with industry-specific solutions like SAP BRIM.

Why FI-CA in Public Cloud?

With businesses moving to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, FI-CA has evolved to deliver:

  • Fit-to-Standard Processes: Preconfigured best practices for faster deployment.
  • Quarterly Innovation Updates: No upgrade projects‚Äîcontinuous delivery of new features.
  • Scalability & Compliance: Built-in support for global accounting standards and tax regulations.
  • Integration with AI & Automation: Smart payment matching, predictive insights, and anomaly detection.

Key Capabilities in Public Cloud

  • Contract Account Management: Manage customer accounts, payment terms, and dunning.
  • Mass Processing: Handle millions of transactions efficiently.
  • Payment Handling: Automated clearing, payment lots, and integration with SAP Cash Application.
  • Event-Based Revenue Recognition: Align revenue with subscription and usage-based billing.
  • Universal Journal Integration: Real-time posting to the General Ledger for transparency.

What‚Äôs New in Public Cloud?

  • AI-Powered Payment Allocation: Reduce manual clarification cases.
  • Embedded Analytics: Real-time dashboards for receivables and collections.
  • Integration with SAP BRIM: End-to-end subscription and usage billing.
  • Standardized Processes: Fit-to-standard approach ensures compliance and reduces complexity.

Benefits for Businesses

  • Lower TCO: No infrastructure overhead, predictable subscription pricing.
  • Faster Time-to-Value: Preconfigured scenarios and SAP Activate methodology.
  • Continuous Innovation: Access to latest features without disruptive upgrades.

Who Should Consider FI-CA in Public Cloud?

  • Utilities & Telecom Providers managing millions of customer transactions.
  • Subscription-Based Businesses looking for flexible billing and revenue recognition.
  • Financial Services aiming for automation in collections and dispute management.

Conclusion

FI-CA in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is not just a migration‚Äîit‚Äôs a transformation. By combining high-volume processing capabilities with cloud agility and AI-driven automation, businesses can streamline operations, improve cash flow, and stay future-ready.

entry.title: Depreciation adjustments when the Asset life cycle is reduced or changed.
entry.content:
Depreciation Example 
 ¬£
Acquisition Value1,000,000
Annual Dep ( 5 years)200,000
Monthly Dep16,667
8 Months Dep133,333
In month 9, we move to new 3 years depreciation policy 
New Acquisition Value866,667
Years Depreciated0.67
Years Remaining2.33
Annual Dep371,429
Monthly Dep (going forward)30,952
  
Note: In this example assets that have already depreciated move than 3years when we move to the new policy would need to be written off 

 

Requirement is Business user expecting after changing the Life cycle of the Asset from 5 years to 3 years . The left over period of depreciation should calculate on the remaining asset value after changing life cycle .

entry.title: Enhancements‚ÄØto‚ÄØCustom CDS Views‚ÄØCreated‚ÄØBased on‚ÄØC-1 Released‚ÄØI_ProjectBillingElement View
entry.content:
This blog is relevant for you if you have‚ÄØcustom CDS views‚ÄØthat‚ÄØare based on the‚ÄØI_ProjectBillingElement‚ÄØ(C-1 released) view.

Introduction

Core Data Services (CDS) is a pivotal technology in the SAP ecosystem, especially within SAP S/4HANA. CDS views are virtual data models that allow you to define and consume semantically rich data models directly on the database. They provide a powerful abstraction layer, enabling developers and business users to access, combine, and analyze data from multiple sources in a consistent and efficient manner.

CDS views are used extensively for reporting, analytics, and extending standard SAP applications without modifying the underlying codebase. They support advanced features such as associations, annotations, and access control, making them a cornerstone of modern SAP development and extensibility.

 

The Role of I_ProjectBillingElement 

Within SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the I_ProjectBillingElement CDS view is a released (C-1) interface view that contains details for the project billing elements. 

Many customers and partners create custom CDS views based on this standard view to tailor reporting and analytics to their specific business needs. However, as SAP continues to enhance its standard content for better performance and scalability, changes to these foundational views can sometimes introduce incompatible changes that require immediate attention from customers who have built custom extensions on top of them. In this blog, we will elaborate on incompatible changes to CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement and the required actions that need to be taken.

 

The Incompatible Change ‚Äî Association Replacement in I_ProjectBillingElement 

With the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602, we have made a significant change to the I_ProjectBillingElement view. The previously used _WBSElement association has been replaced with the _EnterpriseProjectElement association in the I_ProjectBillingElement DCL (data control language).
 
 
Business Impact 
 
If you do not adapt your custom CDS views by republishing them or by explicitly adding associations using developer extensibility tools, users will get unrestricted access to the data. Data control will not be applied correctly, and the system will ignore authorizations for users by default. Therefore, it is very critical to adapt your CDS views as soon as possible.

 
Why this change? 

The new association improves the performance of CDS views that are created based on I_ProjectBillingElement, ensuring faster data retrieval and better scalability for large datasets.

 

Immediate Action Required ‚Äî Impact on Custom CDS Views 

If you have created custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement, these views are now referencing an updated association. This means that your custom CDS views may not function as expected until they are republished. Republishing ensures that all associations and DCLs are correctly created and exposed, aligning your custom views with the latest SAP enhancements.

 

Step-by-Step Process ‚Äî How to Republish Your Custom CDS Views 
 
Scenario 1:  
CDS Views Created Using Key User Extensibility 

If you have created custom CDS views using key user extensibility, you must republish the topmost custom CDS view in your extension hierarchy. Here‚Äôs how:

  1. Log in as Extensibility Specialist. 
    Ensure you have the necessary authorizations to manage and publish custom CDS views.

  2. Navigate to the Custom CDS Views App in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system.

  3. Filter for high-priority tasks. Use the Task Priority filter to display tasks marked as High or Very High. These indicate CDS views that require immediate attention due to the underlying changes.

  4. From the list, select the topmost custom CDS view created based on I_ProjectBillingElement and navigate to the Details page of this custom CDS view.

    For example, if YY1_CDS1 is created based on‚ÄØI_ProjectBillingElement‚ÄØand YY1_CDS2 is created based on YY1_CDS1, then select YY1_CDS2 and perform the further steps. This ensures that all dependent views are updated at once.

  5. In the‚ÄØCustom CDS Views‚ÄØDetail page, click‚ÄØTasks. You will see‚ÄØthe tasks that you need‚ÄØto perform.‚ÄØ

  6. Click‚ÄØEdit.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
  7. Click the‚ÄØPublish‚ÄØbutton‚ÄØat‚ÄØthe bottom-right corner of the screen.‚ÄØ
    The custom CDS views‚ÄØwill be republished.‚ÄØ 

Scenario 2:  
CDS Views Created Using Developer Extensibility Tools 

If you have created custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement in a 3-system landscape using developer extensibility tools, and if the custom views inherit the DCL from I_ProjectBillingElement DCL, then you need to manually add the association and the key for this association in your custom CDS views. This means that you need to explicitly expose _EnterpriseProjectElement association in every custom CDS view that inherits the DCL from I_ProjectBillingElement DCL. You also need to add the field ProjectElementUUID to extract data from _EnterpriseProjectElement association.

 

Why Is This Important? 

  • Performance: The new association (_EnterpriseProjectElement) is optimized for better performance, which can significantly improve reporting and analytics speed.

  • Compatibility: Republishing ensures your custom views remain compatible with the latest SAP standard content, preventing potential errors or data inconsistencies.

  • Future-Proofing: Keeping your custom extensions aligned with SAP‚Äôs ongoing enhancements reduces technical debt and simplifies future upgrades.

Conclusion 

Continuous innovation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition means that standard content, such as CDS views, will evolve for better performance and functionality. While these changes bring significant benefits, they also require customers to stay vigilant and proactive in maintaining their custom extensions.

If you have custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement, the immediate action required is to republish your topmost custom CDS views or expose the required association and field in your custom CDS views, as described above. This process ensures you benefit from SAP‚Äôs latest performance improvements and maintain a robust, future-ready analytics landscape.

By following the outlined steps, you can ensure your custom CDS views continue to deliver value without disruption, leveraging the full power of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äôs ever-evolving capabilities.

entry.title: #CoE #DH01 Intercompany Clearing Issue
entry.content:
Hi all,

Now we have encountered the clearing issue when using "Intercompany" settings.

We have configured Intercompany settings between Company A and B.

So that the system could create journals automatically like below according to Intercompany settings

User creates;

Company A Expense 100 EUR / Company B Cash 100EUR

System creates automatically in each company code ;

[Company A] Expense 100 EUR / Intercompany 100 EUR

[Company B] Intercompany 100 EUR / Cash 100  EUR

Till now, that's working as our expected, however when clearing these Intercompany account,

clearing journals are created for each company code.

As we expected,

Company Code A Intercompany 100 EUR / Company Code B Intercompany 100 EUR

Actually,

Company Code A Intercompany 100 EUR / Company Code A Intercompany 100 EUR

Company Code B Intercompany 100 EUR / Company Code B Intercompany 100 EUR

So again we got another Intercompany amount by this clearing for each company code.

That's of course because, Clearing is done by each company code.

But we are setting Intercompany. Clearing should be done at once and no more another clearing amount here.

Does anyone know how we could execute clearing for Intercompany correctly?

Please give us some advise!

Manami Miyake

entry.title: Unable to add discount percentage to Text items via ManageCustomerInvoiceRequestIn web service
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm trying to create Credit Memo Invoice Requests with discount percentages using the ManageCustomerInvoiceRequestIn web service, but the discount is not being applied when using Text items (items without Product or Service specification).

**Business Requirement:**
Create Credit Memo Invoice Requests with discount percentages applied to Text items via web service.

**What I've Tested:**

**Approach 1: Single-step creation (actionCode="01")**
Created Invoice Request with TypeCode 7PR6 for discount in the initial payload.

Result: Invoice Request created successfully, but discount shows 0%

**Approach 2: Two-step API approach**
- Step 1: Created Invoice Request with actionCode="01" (no discount, no SettlementPriorityCode to keep it in "To Be Invoiced" status)
- Step 2: Updated same Invoice Request with actionCode="02", adding discount via PriceComponent

Result: Update returned success (no error), but discount still shows 0% in UI

**Approach 3: Create via API, then manually edit in UI**
- Created Invoice Request via web service (actionCode="01", omitting SettlementPriorityCode)
- Invoice Request successfully created in "To Be Invoiced" status
- Attempted to add discount manually in the UI

Result: All fields including discount are grayed out (read-only) in the UI

**Sample XML (Step 2 - Update with discount):**
```xml
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xmlns:glob="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
<soap:Header/>
<soap:Body>
<glob:CustomerInvoiceRequestBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
<CustomerInvoiceRequest actionCode="02">
<BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID>TEST_ID</BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID>
<ProposedInvoiceDate>2025-12-01</ProposedInvoiceDate>
<BuyerParty>
<InternalID>CUSTOMER_ID</InternalID>
</BuyerParty>
<SalesUnitParty>
<InternalID>SALES_UNIT_ID</InternalID>
</SalesUnitParty>
<PricingTerms>
<PricingProcedureCode>PPSTD1</PricingProcedureCode>
<CurrencyCode>KRW</CurrencyCode>
</PricingTerms>
<Item>
<BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentItemID>10</BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentItemID>
<ReceivablesPropertyMovementDirectionCode>1</ReceivablesPropertyMovementDirectionCode>
<Description languageCode="EN">Text Item Description</Description>
<Quantity unitCode="EA">1</Quantity>
<QuantityTypeCode>EA</QuantityTypeCode>
<PriceAndTax>
<PriceComponent>
<TypeCode>7PR1</TypeCode>
<Rate>
<DecimalValue>200000</DecimalValue>
<CurrencyCode>KRW</CurrencyCode>
<BaseDecimalValue>1</BaseDecimalValue>
<BaseMeasureUnitCode>EA</BaseMeasureUnitCode>
</Rate>
</PriceComponent>
<PriceComponent>
<TypeCode>7PR6</TypeCode>
<Rate>
<DecimalValue>40</DecimalValue>
</Rate>
</PriceComponent>
</PriceAndTax>
<ProductTaxDetails>
<ProductTaxationCharacteristicsCode listID="KR">310</ProductTaxationCharacteristicsCode>
</ProductTaxDetails>
<AccountingCodingBlockAssignment>
<AccountingCodingBlock>
<AccountingCodingBlockTypeCode>ACC</AccountingCodingBlockTypeCode>
<GeneralLedgerAccountAliasCode>GL_CODE</GeneralLedgerAccountAliasCode>
</AccountingCodingBlock>
</AccountingCodingBlockAssignment>
</Item>
</CustomerInvoiceRequest>
</glob:CustomerInvoiceRequestBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>
```

**Note:** This issue only occurs with Text items. When using Material or Service items (with Product node specified), discounts apply correctly.

**Questions:**
1. Is there a working method to add discount percentages to Text items via web service (either single-step or two-step)?
2. Is there a way to make Invoice Requests created via web service editable in the UI so discounts can be added manually?
3. Is this a known limitation or bug for Text items?
4. Are there any additional fields or configurations required specifically for Text items?

I have an open support case on this issue, but would appreciate any community insights or workarounds.

Thank you in advance for any assistance.

---

entry.title: Evolving Our Value Accelerators: Announcing Upcoming Procurement Content Updates Q4 2025
entry.content:
Posted by: SAP Signavio Product Management

At SAP Signavio, we are committed to evolving our solutions to provide you with the most powerful and user-friendly tools for continuous business process transformation. A key part of this commitment is enhancing our portfolio of Procurement Value Accelerators.

From Siloed Data to End-to-End Insight

To achieve this, we have been hard at work developing new, state-of-the-art content. Using our existing Ariba-related accelerators as a baseline, we have engineered new dashboards and, most significantly, a unified end-to-end Source-to-Pay (S2P) pipeline.

This change allows you to analyze each stage of your source-to-pay process from sourcing to contracting to procurement within a single integrated pipeline, with all insights brought together in dedicated dashboards.

As we introduce this powerful new content, we have identified an overlap with some of our older Value Accelerators. To reduce complexity for you, we will replace obsolete content.

This step allows us to focus our resources on delivering the best possible experience and ensures you are working with the most relevant and powerful content available.

What‚Äôs Changing for Procurement Value Accelerators?

It follows a breakdown of the upcoming changes.

Packages Being Retired

The following packages will be retired, as their key performance indicators and analyses are now more effectively integrated into our new, more holistic persona-based dashboards.

  • Reduce Finance Costs for Procure to Pay in SAP Ariba
  • Reduce overall Supply Chain Planning Costs for Source Products and Services in SAP Ariba

Packages Being Updated

The following packages will be updated to leverage the new, unified data pipeline.

  • Start Mining for Procure to Pay in SAP Ariba
  • Start Mining for Source Product and Services in SAP Ariba

For both packages, the existing pipeline will be replaced with the newly built end-to-end S2P pipeline: Identify improvement potential for Source to Pay in SAP Ariba 

Important: The dashboards within these updated packages will be temporarily retained to ensure a smooth transition. However, they are scheduled to be replaced by fully renovated, persona-based dashboards in a future update. We are actively working on this next wave of content and will share more details as we get closer to the release.

Impact and Your Next Steps

We want to make this transition as smooth as possible. Here‚Äôs what you need to know:

  • What about my existing content? If you have already downloaded any of the affected packages, you can continue to use your local installations without any issues. The deprecation only affects the availability for new downloads from the Value Accelerator Library.
  • How do I handle customizations? We understand that many of you have customized your pipelines and dashboards. You can continue using your customized content in the old assets or migrate your customizations to the new assets. We have created a comprehensive guide to help you with this process.
  • Our Maintenance Commitment: Going forward, our primary maintenance and bug-fix efforts will be focused on the new and updated content available in the Value Accelerator Library. After the replacement  date, maintenance for the removed packages will be discontinued. If a bug is reported in content that is no longer on the library, we will provide a solution for the customer and apply the fix to the corresponding KPIs within the new, actively maintained Value Accelerators.

Timeline

To give you ample time to adapt, we have established a transition path.

  • Now ‚Äì May 31, 2026: Six-month transition period. The older Value Accelerators will remain available for download.
  • June 1, 2026: The replaced Value Accelerators will be removed from the library, and engineering maintenance on them will be discontinued.

We're Here to Help

We are confident these changes will provide a more powerful, streamlined, and insightful experience for analyzing your procurement processes.

For detailed instructions on migrating your custom content, please refer to our help page:

  • Migration of customized content

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us or your SAP Signavio representative.

Thank you for being a valued customer.

 

SAP Signavio Product Management Team

entry.title: Major updates to the Attachments plugin ‚Äì multi-cloud support, malware scanning and more
entry.content:
The SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) model prides itself on enabling rapid application development by abstracting away complexities and letting developers focus on the domain.

CAP‚Äôs Calesi (CAP-level Service Interfaces) pattern takes this further by reducing the amount of boilerplate code developers need to write when integrating with SAP BTP services.

One such example of a useful plugin is the Attachments plugin. The CAP Attachments plugin enables developers to seamlessly add file upload and management capabilities to their applications, handling everything from storage integration to UI components out of the box. By abstracting the complexity of working with object stores and file handling it allows developers to implement secure, production-ready attachment functionality out of the box or with minimal code.

 This plugin has been available for a while and is heavily adopted by the community. In response to developer feedback about missing features, documentation gaps, and bugs, we‚Äôve spent the last few months upgrading the plugin, and the CAP team is excited to release the ‚Äúnew and improved‚Äù attachments plugin for in Java and Node.js.

Here are the latest improvements:

Feature parity ‚Äì with the recent set of enhancements, both the Node.js (v 3.4.0 onwards) and Java (v 1.2.2 onwards) plugins now have the following features:

  1. Multi-cloud support (GCP Storage, AWS S3, Azure Blob) - Deploy flexibly across cloud providers
  2. Malware scanning on upload of attachments. (The Node.js plugin additionally supports mTLS authentication for the malware scanning service)
  3. Enhanced monitoring and logging capabilities

 New features currently available for the Node.js plugin only (v3.4.0 onwards):

  1. Multi-tenancy support for all storage providers
  2. Dynamic visibility control for the attachments panel on the UI using UI5 hidden facet
entity Books {
  status : Integer enum {
    submitted =  1;
    fulfilled =  2;
    shipped   =  3;
    canceled  = -1;
  };
  @ui.Hidden : (status = #canceled ? true : false)
  attachments: Composition of many Attachments;
}

       3. Translations for all model texts in SAP-supported languages

       4. Standard kind to let the plugin automatically decide which object store provider to use

{
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "attachments": {
        "kind": "standard"
      }
    }
  }
}

           5. UI5 validation methods to define the maximum file size and accepted media types

annotate my.Books.attachments with {
  content .AcceptableMediaTypes: ['image/jpeg'] @Validation.Maximum: '2MB';
}

You can read the details on the Java and Node.js GitHub pages of the plugin. 

 

And this is not all. We have overhauled the documentation of both the plugins to make sure that you have the latest and most accurate information available.

The team strives to continue enhancing this and other plugins to provide developers with increased productivity.

In case you would like to share some feedback with us, please write to us on cap@sap.com

Ready to try it out? Happy coding!

entry.title: Introducing Application Vulnerability Report for Cloudfoundry Applications ‚Äì Try It Now!
entry.content:
What Is Application Vulnerability Report?

Security is a top priority in today‚Äôs digital landscape, especially when applications rely heavily on open-source components. These components, while powerful and cost-effective, often come with publicly known vulnerabilities that can put your business data at risk.

The Application Vulnerability Report is a newly introduced feature for SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) services that helps you detect and remediate vulnerabilities in your Cloud Foundry applications. This tool scans your application for known security issues based on Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs), ensuring that you stay ahead of potential threats.

 

Go to Entitlements in your SAP BTP Sub-account to add Application Vulnerability Report to add the plans

Service Marketplace

Search for application-vulnerability-report-service in the SAP BTP Service Marketplace

Create Instance in your Cloudfoundry space

  • Go to your cloudfoundry Space (example : Dev, UAT, TST...etc)
  • Create a new Instance for Application Vulnerability Report with default plan
  • Provide a Instance Name

Create Service Key

  • Create a New Service Key for API Access

Allow the User to Access the Space

You need to manually add the application-vulnerability-report-scanner@sap.com user to your Cloud Foundry space. This enables the application vulnerability report to download the droplets of the respective applications and scan them accordingly.

  1. Log on to the CF space that you want to scan.
  2. Select the Space Members tab and choose Add Member.
  3. Enter the application-vulnerability-report-scanner@sap.com user and assign the Space Auditor role to it.

Why Is This Important?

Open-source vulnerabilities are one of the most frequent security challenges in modern application development. Attackers are quick to exploit these weaknesses, and failing to address them promptly can lead to severe consequences, including data breaches and compliance violations.

By using the Application Vulnerability Report, you can:

  • Identify vulnerabilities early in your application lifecycle.
  • Understand the severity of each issue based on CVE data.
  • Take corrective actions quickly to secure your SAP BTP landscape.

 

Application Vulnerability Report  - Process overview

The application vulnerability report supports you in the detection of vulnerabilities in custom applications during runtime. Instead of a shift-left support approach during pipeline runs, this service provides security-relevant information for what has already been deployed (and maybe forgotten). The service scans the applications using a proprietary scanning layer that utilizes open-source scanners such as Open Source Vulnerabilities (OSV) and trivy, as well as custom SAP BTP-specific and 0-day exploit targeted scanners. This unique combination offers a very broad and up-to-date coverage of vulnerabilities in your applications. By using an API, you can integrate the report data into your incident and security workflow.

Overview of the each Process flow

1. Applications Running on SAP BTP

  • This is the starting point.
  • It includes all your Cloud Foundry applications deployed on SAP Business Technology Platform.
  • These applications often use open-source libraries and packages, which can have vulnerabilities.

2. Scanning Layer

This layer performs the security scans on your applications. It consists of multiple scanning sources:

  • Commercial
    Uses commercial vulnerability databases and tools to identify known issues.

  • Trivy/OSV
    Trivy is an open-source vulnerability scanner, and OSV (Open Source Vulnerabilities) is a database of vulnerabilities in open-source software.
    These help detect issues in widely used open-source components.

  • BTP Specific
    Scans for vulnerabilities specific to SAP BTP services and configurations, ensuring platform-level security.

  • 0 Day
    Focuses on zero-day vulnerabilities, which are newly discovered and not yet patched.
    These are critical because attackers often exploit them quickly.

3. Application Vulnerability Report for SAP BTP

  • After scanning, all findings are consolidated into a single report.
  • This report provides:
    • List of vulnerabilities
    • Severity levels
    • Recommendations for remediation
  • It acts as a centralized dashboard for security insights.

4. API for Customers

  • Customers can access the report via API.
  • This allows integration with:
    • Security dashboards
    • CI/CD pipelines
    • Monitoring tools
  • Ensures automation and continuous security checks.

5. Customers

  • End-users (developers, security teams) consume the report and take corrective actions to secure applications.

 

Technical Usage

How to get findings of your deployed CF applications running..

 

 

Reference :

  • Initial Setup Process
  • Authentication Process
  • Audit Logging Process

entry.title: Re: IBP statistical forecasting in specified UOM
entry.content:
Hi Rahul,

We already use a standardized UOM as described above and we currently run the forecast using it.  The issue is that the documentation implies that the forecast is run in base uom which we take from S4 Hana.  We have all the base UOMs set to pieces in these product lines, but one piece could be 5m2 another 100m2.  It is important that the forecast aggregates the historical quantities in m2 and not pieces as essentially a customer could order 10 x 10m2 pieces or 1 x 100m2 piece for the same space, from a forecasting perspective we want those to be considered the same within the product line.

I am going to set up a test to confirm that the target UOM is only considered for output as the documentation isn't totally clear and its hard to make a case for setting an output UOM as it will be converted back to base anyhow.

I appreciate the response, and if the statistical forecast actually converts the input history to target UOM our problem is resolved as we have pieces to m2 UOM conversions defined on every material already,

Cheers,

Jez

entry.title: MF50 - No scheduling selected - not possible to move dispatched orders in Graphical view
entry.content:
Hello,

In OPU5, I did not select the scheduling box‚Äîonly the generate capacity planning option. The reason for this is that we want the flexibility to change both the start and end dates of a planned order, even if the produced quantity remains the same. This allows us to adjust production rates for specific orders and helps avoid unnecessary production line stoppages.

For example, although it typically takes one day to produce 10 tons, sometimes we extend this to three days simply to keep the production line running. In such cases, we intentionally reduce the production rate to avoid the costs associated with stopping and restarting the line.

This approach works well in the planning table, where I can easily adjust the dates. However, when I use the graphical Gantt chart and try to move the DISPATCHED planned order, the system does not allow me to shift it earlier or later using the mouse. Instead, I have to open the order and manually edit the dates.

Is this normal behavior, or is there a setting I may have missed?

Thank you very much for your assistance.

entry.title: SAP for Freshers: The Stuff No One Tells You at the Start
entry.content:
Part 1 of my ‚ÄúFresh Off the Cloud: CX Made Simple for Freshers & Curious Minds‚Äù series ‚Äî a beginner-friendly collection for freshers stepping into the SAP world.

When I look back at my journey over the last few years, it feels surreal.

I started as an intern at SAP ‚Äî excited, clueless, and honestly just grateful for my first real break. I slowly found my lane in SAP Commerce Cloud, explored SAP AI, and eventually got staffed on my first major client project ‚Äî a globally known theme park brand.

It has been confusing, chaotic, humbling, educational‚Ä¶ and honestly, a lot more fun than I expected.

Here are a few things I wish someone had told me when I started.

  1. The first few months are 80% confusion, 20% confidence

Back then, words like:

  • impex
  • OCC
  • interceptors
  • flexible search
  • localextensions
    felt like alien to me .

But here‚Äôs the secret:
Every expert you know was once just a confused rookie.

You learn by:  imposter syndrome , fake it till you make it and also by -

  • touching things
  • breaking things
  • fixing things
  • googling things (or, chat-gpting them)
  • pretending to understand things
  • and slowly, truly understanding them

2. Commerce Cloud doesn‚Äôt hate you ‚Äî it just expects effort

You quickly learn things like:

  • builds take time
  • one small config can break everything
  • logs are your best friend
  • understanding the business matters more than writing fancy code

But at the same time, Commerce Cloud is fun when you get the hang of it ‚Äî APIs, extensions, validations, authentication flows, all start feeling intuitive

3. What My First Client Project Actually Felt Like

I won‚Äôt lie ‚Äî joining my first real project felt less like ‚Äúentering the battlefield‚Äù and more like entering a WhatsApp group where everyone already knows the inside jokes.

Suddenly I was working for a theme-park based company.
Which sounds very cool‚Ä¶ until you realise 90% of your day is:

  • understanding what the business actually wants
  • fixing tiny-but-important issues
  • making sure flows don‚Äôt break
  • figuring out why QA found 14 bugs in something that worked perfectly yesterday
  • and pretending you understand requirements on the first try (none of us do)

It wasn‚Äôt ‚Äúhigh stakes, high traffic, zero tolerance.‚Äù
It was more like:

‚ÄúOkay Shivam, here‚Äôs 1 Jira ticket. Break it down. Don‚Äôt panic. You‚Äôll be fine.‚Äù

And honestly?
That approach worked.

The real learning came from:

  • pairing with seniors
  • making mistakes and fixing them
  • understanding how even small features impact the whole system
  • slowly becoming the guy who says ‚Äúyeah, I can handle this‚Äù

The theme-park part was just the flavour ‚Äî the real challenge was growing into a developer who could take ownership without someone holding your hand.

4. AI in SAP Isn‚Äôt Just Hype ‚Äî It‚Äôs Hands-On Power

My AI journey inside SAP wasn‚Äôt about generic AI tools.
It was about actual SAP-native AI environments like:

  • Design Studio
  • Transformate
  • SAP‚Äôs own AI orchestration & modeling layers

This taught me that AI is:

  • not a threat
  • not complicated magic
  • not only for data scientists

AI helps teams:

  • generate insights faster
  • design flows visually
  • automate repetitive work
  • enhance customer experiences
  • reduce support load
  • build smarter journeys

Freshers who embrace AI early don‚Äôt become ‚ÄúAI people.‚Äù
They become future-proof engineers.

5. The First Time Your Code Goes Live‚Ä¶ Unforgettable

There‚Äôs a moment every developer remembers.

It‚Äôs when your code moves from:
‚Äúlocal‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúQA‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúUAT‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúproduction‚Äù

You feel:

  • fear
  • adrenaline
  • disbelief
  • pride

And then you realize ‚Äî your work now impacts thousands of real people.

That‚Äôs the moment you stop feeling like a fresher.

6. The best part? You slowly become confident without noticing

Growth in SAP is not overnight.
It‚Äôs small wins stacking up:

  • fixing something without help
  • understanding the architecture better
  • owning a feature
  • being trusted with more work
  • writing clean, neat solutions
  • actually explaining things to new folks

One day you look back and think:
‚ÄúYou know what? I‚Äôve come pretty far.‚Äù

And you have.

In the end‚Ä¶

Your first years in SAP aren‚Äôt about being perfect.
They‚Äôre about getting comfortable being a learner.

If you stay curious, keep experimenting, and don‚Äôt shy away from asking questions ‚Äî you‚Äôll grow much faster than you expect.

And honestly?
It‚Äôs been a pretty good ride so far.

entry.title: Bulgaria and the Euro Introduction. What this Means for SAP Business Warehouse
entry.content:
Introduction

Bulgaria will officially adopt the euro on January 1, 2026, a fixed conversion rate at 1 EUR = 1.9558 BGN will apply. That sounds simple, but in SAP BW it affects master data, key figures, currency translation logic, historical reporting, planning, and data loads from your ERP, e.g. S/4. If you have Bulgarian entities or consolidate Bulgarian figures centrally, now is the time to decide how BW should store and translate currencies before and after Go-Live.

Key BW Design Question: Store in BGN, Euro, or Both?

In BW, the right solution depends on what your business needs for reporting and auditability. Practically, you have different main approaches:

1) Keep Storing BGN, Translate to Euro at Query Runtime

Idea: No change to InfoProviders; you keep BGN as currency in your persistent layers. Queries translate to Euro using currency translation.

When this fits:

  • You want a maximum historical purity (data stays as originally booked).
  • You already use query-time translation for group currency.
  • You don‚Äôt need Euro-native planning key figures or planning reference data.

How to implement:

  • Maintain TCURR / TCURF / TCURX correctly and ensure the fixed rate exists.
  • Use a currency translation type in queries (e.g., current rate, fixed rate, or time-dependent rate).
  • For postings after 01.01.2026, your source systems will likely send Euro and BW becomes multi-currency in the persistent layers

Pros:

  • Lowest effort / lowest risk.
  • Historical values remain untouched.

Cons:

  • Reporting performance cost at query runtime.

2) Convert & Store Euro in BW (Physical Conversion)

Idea: You convert BGN key figures into Euro during loading or in a one-time migration, so Euro becomes the stored currency.

When this fits:

  • Business wants one single reporting currency for Bulgaria after 2026.
  • You do planning/forecasting in BW and want Euro-based key figures.

How to implement:

  • Convert the impacted InfoProviders (SAP Note 3220814 - Currency conversion tool for ADSOs and HANA optimized cubes might be helpful including the patches already deliverd by SAP).
  • In transformations or DTPs, run currency conversion using the fixed rate.
  • Optionally run a historical conversion to repopulate old periods in EUR.
  • Or if possible, do a full reload from ERP if the ERP project is live (might be differ depending on source of data, but mainly your source will be ERP)

Pros:

  • Queries are faster and simpler (no runtime conversion).
  • Users always see EUR consistently.

Cons

  • More modeling effort and data volume.
  • You must document conversion logic for audit.
  • You lose original currency stored unless you keep BGN alongside.

3) Dual Storage: Keep BGN and Add Euro as a Second Key Figure

Idea: Store both currencies in BW; BGN for original values, Euro for standardized reporting.

When this fits:

  • You need audit-proof traceability
  • You want to compare pre and post 2026 data seamlessly

How to implement

  • Add EUR key figures in the same Provider (or a side-car ADSO).
  • Convert during load with the fixed rate.
  • Queries expose Euro as default, with BGN available (hidden default)

Pros

  • Best of both worlds.
  • Easy transition for business users.

Cons

  • Higher storage and ETL complexity.
  • Requires clear naming and semantics in reporting.

Conversion Rate Handling in BW: Fixed vs. Time-Dependent

Even though the conversion rate is fixed legally (1.9558), BW still needs a rule to apply it correctly. Fixed Rate Translation would mean you Maintain a fixed rate type for BGN-Euro until 31.12.9999. Time-Dependent Translation (until cutover) would mean you maintain for 2025 and earlier, different rates. This might be interesting for global reporting requirements at average rates and management reporting.

Recommendation int his case would be to create two translation types:

  • Market/average rate for historical/management views.
  • BGN Euro fixed rate for legal and post-cutover views.

Planning in BW-IP / BPC / SAC with BPC Live and SAC Native

If planning is on the roadmap:

  • Ensure planning level currencies don‚Äôt mix BGN and EUR in one key figure.
  • Favor Euro stored key figures for 2026+ planning cycles.
  • Keep a conversion function for legacy BGN scenarios only.
  • Make sure you also take care of the topic inside SAC

Data Flow Impacts from Source Systems

After 01.01.2026, your ERP system will likely post in EUR as local currency and still hold historical BGN documents. So BW extractors may deliver old documents in BGN and new documents in Euro.

That means BW must be ready for multi-currency delta loads. This should be considered as well.

Practical Cutover Checklist for BW Teams

  • Lock the legal conversion rate in currency tables.
  • Define translation types (market vs fixed).
  • Decide your storage approach:
    • BGN-only + query translation
    • Euro-only physical conversion
    • Dual storage
  • Adjust transformations/DTP routines if physical conversion is chosen.
  • Analyze special implementations in:
    • Queries
    • Planning functions
    • Global reporting

Talk to your business to have a common understanding what will happen on ERP and what will happen in BW.

Final Thought: Choose Simplicity

Such projects are usually a one-time action. It is important not to overcomplicate it. But, on the other hand, you also should not make shortcuts. Understanding what is happening in the source systems and the requirements from Business is key. 

 

https://me.sap.com/notes/3220814/EN

entry.title: product/material char 18 to 40 SAP public cloud-Is It Possible to Increase Material Number Length
entry.content:
We are live on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and currently using the standard Material Number length of 18 characters.

The business now wants to increase the material code (MATNR) length to around 40 characters.

We would like to understand:

  1. Is it technically possible to increase the material number length from 18 to 40 characters in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

  2. If not directly possible, are there any SAP-recommended alternatives?

  3. What is the impact of increasing material number length (if allowed) or changing identification design on:

    • BTP custom applications

    • Output forms and print layouts

    • CDS views and analytics

    • APIs and integrations

    • Interfaces with external systems

    • Performance or data model limitations

  4. Has anyone implemented a similar change post go-live in Public Cloud?

    • What challenges were faced?

    • What trade-offs were required?

Given that we already have multiple:

  • BTP extensions

  • Custom reports

  • Integrations

  • Output templates

we want to understand the feasibility and risk before proposing any redesign.

Any expert guidance or real-life experience would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Meet Joule: Your AI Copilot for SAP Master Data Governance
entry.content:
If there‚Äôs one thing we all want more of in our workday, it‚Äôs time. What if you could skip the clicks, stop hunting through endless menus, and just ask for the data or task you need right when you need it? That‚Äôs exactly what Joule, SAP‚Äôs powerful generative AI assistant, brings to the table. Today, we‚Äôll explore Joule‚Äôs capabilities, then zoom in on how it takes SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) to a brand-new level of usability and efficiency.

What is Joule?

Joule is SAP‚Äôs generative AI assistant, designed to help you interact with your SAP systems in the simplest way: conversation. Whether you need business information, want to complete a task, or are searching for a specific insight, just ask Joule in plain language. Joule can retrieve information, complete routine tasks, guide you to the right application, or even explore your business data with you, all within the familiar SAP ecosystem.

You can work with Joule in multiple conversation threads, review or delete expired conversations, and move seamlessly between ongoing dialogues. Its capabilities are broad, spanning transactional, navigational, informational, and analytical scenarios.

 

Why Joule?

Joule is not just about simplifying tasks; it is about connecting everyone in your company, especially business users, with professional Master Data Governance (MDG) capabilities. This means that even users without extensive knowledge of MDG applications can accelerate business processes with ease. By removing the need to build custom user interfaces, Joule lowers total cost of ownership, reduces the resources needed to manage MDG, and streamlines communication by automating routine governance tasks. Here are some of the key business benefits Joule brings to your organization:

Enhanced Accessibility and Ease of Use
With Joule, access to core MDG features is democratized. Employees from any department can seamlessly engage in data governance tasks no matter where they are, eliminating the heavy reliance on specialized MDG experts. This opens up data quality and integrity efforts to a broader team and fosters a more inclusive data culture.

Efficiency in Business Processes
Joule automates routine tasks and provides intuitive conversational interfaces for complex operations. As a result, business processes move faster, and everyone spends less time managing data, leading to a significant boost in productivity.

Cost Reduction and TCO Savings
Because Joule delivers built-in, user-friendly interfaces out of the box, there is no need to invest in developing or supporting custom UIs. This helps companies save on development costs and ongoing maintenance, making the solution more cost-effective.

Improved Data Quality
By leveraging large language models to identify and correct errors, Joule helps catch anomalies and typos at the point of entry. This results in better, more consistent data from the start, supporting confident decision-making throughout the business.

Enhanced User Experience
The conversational, intuitive design of Joule makes working with complex data simpler and more enjoyable. Employees can interact with the system naturally, leading to higher satisfaction, stronger engagement, and increased productivity across the company.

Implementing Joule in your MDG landscape brings tangible business value by improving accessibility, accelerating processes, cutting costs, enhancing data quality, and ensuring scalable data management as your organization grows.

Joule for Master Data Governance: A New Era of Productivity

To  help you understand what does this base MDG Joule AI Feature in SAP Business AI Catalog offers, let‚Äôs dive into what makes Joule a game-changer for Master Data Governance.

With SAP Master Data Governance on S/4HANA 2023 FSP0 Private Cloud, customers can use following Joule capabilities to enable their business users:

Effortlessly Search and Display Business Partners

Searching for Business Partners is smarter now. You can search by almost any attribute, such as name, address, bank details, tax ID, or even birthdate:

  • ‚ÄúFind all Business Partners in Munich.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúSearch BPs with IBAN 789789.‚Äù

Joule provides results instantly and can guide you to detailed views or relevant applications for further action.

Display Business Partners

Need to look up a specific Business Partner‚Äôs information? Just type:

  • ‚ÄúShow me the bank details for BP 1234567.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúDisplay details for Business Partner 345678.‚Äù

‚ÄÉ

Joule can retrieve overviews, basic details, bank accounts, identification numbers, address usages, payment cards, roles, contact relationships, and more. You don‚Äôt need to know in advance where in the system this data resides, Joule brings it to you. Once you have the information that you need, you can open the Business Partner record from the Joule chat window or continue working on the record through Joule.

Create Business Partners  (cloud-ready mode)

Creating or updating Business Partners has never been easier. Instead of navigating multiple screens, you can tell Joule what you need in natural language:

  • ‚ÄúCreate a new organization named ABC Corp with address in Berlin.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúCreate a new person.‚Äù (and let Joule walk you through the steps)

Joule guides you through supplying only the necessary details, checks for duplicates, and creates the governance process. Of course, you can always choose to submit, retype, or decline the process‚Äîall within your conversational flow.

Edit Business Partners (cloud-ready mode) - On the Fly 

Need to update a detail? No need to open multiple transactions:

  • ‚ÄúChange the organization name for BP 1234567.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúChange the email to example@example.com for partner 4711.‚Äù

Joule manages the governance workflow for these changes, letting you save drafts, submit them for approval or even cancel as needed.

Query MDG Process (cloud-ready mode)

Joule isn‚Äôt stopping there. With S/4HANA 2025 Private Cloud, managing your governance processes just became much more intuitive:

Now, you can search not just for Business Partners, but for the governance processes themselves - across Central Governance, Consolidation, and Data Quality areas. Need to find a process by the process ID, who created it, its status, or when it was created? Just ask:

  • ‚ÄúShow my last process.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúFind high priority processes from last week.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúDisplay all processes created by John.‚Äù

Once you find a process, Joule brings you the essential details: process ID, status, priority, and more. Need to understand what‚Äôs going on with a particular record? Request:

  • ‚ÄúShow me the details of process 1234.‚Äù

And from there, you can jump straight to related Business Partner data or the relevant management app.

Bringing It Together

Joule is redefining how we interact with Master Data Governance in SAP. With intuitive conversational access, you can create, search, display, and edit Business Partners or even manage governance processes - without losing your flow or context. No more clicking through menus or remembering transaction codes. You get instant, accurate responses, all backed by the power and security of SAP.

Ready to work smarter? Meet Joule, and experience next-level productivity in Master Data Governance. Take a moment to also check our video on the newest Joule capabilities in MDG with demos and examples.

Interested in learning more about Joule‚Äôs capabilities or how to enable it for your team? Reach out to your SAP contact or check out the SAP Help Portal for the latest documentation and setup guides.

entry.title: Re: Need to check Process order type Costing variant conf...
entry.content:
Good day @Arvinder_Rauthan1 

To my knowledge, that is a function the public cloud does not offer. The reason is, the public cloud‚Äôs clean-core principle does not provide configuration because costing variants are delivered and fixed. This basically means that you cannot access or customize costing variants the way you would in ECC or On-premise (for example through OKKN or KKS1).

However, the public cloud also allows you to view and influence costing behaviour through some Apps (e.g., Manage Activity Types and Manage Cost Rates) and SSCUIs (e.g., Define Overhead Costing Sheet).

Since you cannot change the variants, I suggest you check them inside the production order itself and not in the configuration.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: how to post a GR without a PO
entry.content:
Use Movement Type 501 ‚Äì Goods Receipt without PO (Unplanned Receipt)

This is the simplest and most common method.

T-Code: MIGO or MB1C

Process:

  1. Go to MIGO
  2. Select Goods Receipt ‚Üí Other
  3. Enter Movement Type = 501
  4. Enter material, plant, storage location, quantity
  5. Post the document

When to use:

  • You received stock but no PO exists
  • Returned items that you want to put back into unrestricted stock
  • Free-of-charge items or unplanned receipts

entry.title: SAC Multiactions: Schedule with dependency
entry.content:
Hello,

We have 3 Multiactions in which we load master data, hierarchies and transactional data. It is not possible to use all the steps in one multiaction as it exceeds the limit of 50 steps. 

Now we want to schedule the data loading multiple times in a day and the multiactions should load sequentially, after successful loading of one the next should start. It works fine If we set it up for one occurence. If we want this dependent behaviour to reoccur e.g. 4 times in a day with an end data for example 06.12.2025, then it does not work as it asks which recurring event it is dependent on, which means I have to set up every data load manually. 

For example, if we load dimensions and actuals using two multiactions

First Multiaction task in Calendar to load dimensions:

Second Calendar Task to load Actuals which should be dependent on the first task "Load Dimensions"

While choosing the event it asks which event, means which reccurence 

If I choose all, the dependent task moves to the last occurence, which means all the loading dimensions task should run on every day and "load actuals" will be triggered after the last occurence of "load dimensions"

I have tried different ways like a with a parent process, composite task etc., nothing seems to work. Does anyone have/had similar requirement and how it was solved?

Thanks & Regards,

M.S.

entry.title: Re: modes of transport
entry.content:
Hi Ram,

You can view the Mode of Transport in the Sales Order by opening the order and checking the Shipping tab. The SAP Cloud Transport Management Group fields help determine which transport mode is applied through route determination

In the Delivery Document, you can also see the transport details in the header under the Shipping or Transportation section. The values are copied from the sales order based on the route.

If your company uses external logistics tools, solutions like InstaDispatch can also help define or sync transport modes for smoother planning, but mention it only if the forum allows external product references

Hope this helps.

entry.title: Change of Predefined Billing Document Number Range IR (1000000000-1999999999)
entry.content:
We have a multiple company setup in one S/4 Public Cloud system, the companies are numbered from 1000 onwards until at the moment 2900, over 100 companies.

We apply company specific numbering of billing documents, the Billing Document Number is prefixed with the company number, e..g. for company 1000: 1000000001 - 1000999999

However, this conflicts with the predefined billing document number range IR: 1000000000-1999999999.

We would like to change this IR range into a range outside the company number range, for example: 0040000000-049999999

But: S/4 Public Cloud doesn't allow to change the IR range at all, it is locked because it is predefined. Even when the range is not used het (range status = 0), a change is not allowed.

This blocks our number range approach for about a 100 companies in company number range 1000-1999.

What are the possibilities to allow a change of a (unused) predefined number range enabling us to apply our number range approach to these companies as well ?

Note: alphanumeric characters are unwanted

entry.title: Re: Public cloud: Sales order custom field data is not po...
entry.content:
Dear @Rajender123,

In Public Cloud this sometimes yes / sometimes no behavior most often happens because Track Sales Orders / Track Sales Order Details don‚Äôt necessarily read the sales order header in real time. They are part of the Sales Order Fulfillment scenario and typically consume a fulfillment/issue data source a derived ‚Äúsnapshot‚Äù used for monitoring) If that dataset isn‚Äôt refreshed for a given sales order yet or your custom field isn‚Äôt enabled for that exact data source, the value can look intermittent

I reproduced the case in my environment and each time I saw the value in the field (Custom Field) in Track Sales Orders app

What I do:

  • Open App Custom Fields and add field

 

  • In User Interfaces tab add:
    • Track Sales Orders

 

    • Manage sales orders and SAP GUI

 

 

    • Sales Order Fulfillment

 

  • Save and Publish
  • Refresh SAP

 

Additional information and more details from SAP Note and Help Portal below:

Some sales order apps work with draft tracking/monitoring apps typically read the active persisted version. If users sometimes save draft / navigate away differently, Track may show the previous active state.

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3619567

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a376cd9ea00d476b96f18dea1247e6a5/15d1f0812d0f42e8a12ff60bac66b567.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=2508.500

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Packaging Instruction Determination Not Triggering Di...
entry.content:
Hello @vicentejarque 

Thank you for your question.

You seem to be configuring a SAPGUI-style packaging instruction selection dialog and this does not exist in the public cloud. While public cloud allows packaging instruction determination, it does not support both VL31N and interactive selection dialog.

The cloud tends to perform automatic determination of the best matching packaging instruction and alternative PIs are determined by the background logic.

In public cloud you should:

  • Ensure your PI determination records are correct (e.g., Material, Plant, Customer, etc.),
  • Use a Fiori app that supports PI determination (e.g., Change Inbound Deliveries)

  • and test your determination by using Pack Handling Units App. Here you can propose packaging in the inbound delivery.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Universal Component Breakdown (UCB) on SAP Community ‚Äì All you need to know!
entry.content:
Universal Component Breakdown (UCB) offers comprehensive transparency and insights into the cost structures of products, specifically targeting the costs of goods manufactured and sold. This innovation addresses a critical business need, enabling companies to better understand and manage cost factors that influence product profitability and company contribution margins.

UCB will continuously replace the existing product costing capability with an innovative and streamlined solution tailored for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. 

We have collected the most relevant sources of information for you here in a new SAP Community Page - including detailed blog posts, getting started information, KBAs, Learnings and more:

Your feedback is very welcome! Take a look and let us know if there‚Äôs anything you‚Äôd like to see added.

entry.title: Re: Copy Text from Sevrice Order to Billing Document
entry.content:
Hello @simon_all4cloud41,

Another option how to transfer notes from Service Confirmation to Billing is to use the Text Type "Sales Text". This text type is available in Service Confirmation Item. In parallel, you can go ahead raising the requirement to have header notes available in Service Confirmations via the Customer Influence Portal.

Best regards,
Julius - SAP Cloud ERP Consulting

entry.title: Consuming your own (or external) Web Components in UI5 Applications
entry.content:
Consuming your own (or external) Web Components in UI5 Applications

This post summarizes my learnings on how to consume arbitrary web components natively in UI5 applications. This is a powerful alternative to UI5 custom controls, since web components are framework-agnostic and can be reused in other contexts as well.

A lot of people perceive UI5 as a control library only, or at least a frontend framework that is very closely tied to its control library, but it's actually much more than that. It's a very powerful and flexible framework that can be extended and used in many different ways.

During the Developer Keynote at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore 2025 (no online recording unfortunately), I demoed the flexibility and openness of UI5 by showing two approaches for extending UI5 application with custom elements:

The first approach has been around for quite a while and is well known: developing UI5 custom controls. With this approach, you essentially create new UI5 controls by extending existing UI5 controls. This approach has the advantage of being fully integrated into the UI5 framework, but it also means it is tightly coupled to UI5. You cannot reuse UI5 custom controls for applications that are not based on UI5. However, since third-party packages (e.g. from npm) can be consumend inside UI5 applications as well (see ui5-tooling-modules), this approach is by no means limited. Check out this repository for detailed instructions on how to build a UI5 custom control that renders a 3D model of a supermarket to guide customers to a product's location: ui5-advanced-exercises-codejam

The second approach is very new to UI5: building your own web components and consuming them natively in UI5 applications. This approach is framework-agnostic, as the technologies that make up web components are open web standards. This means you can (re)use the same web components in any web application, regardless of the framework. Think of whole design systems that could be built using this approach, and then be reused in UI5/React/Angular/Vue applications alike! This blog post focuses on this second approach.

To demonstrate this capability, we first need a web component. For the sake of simplicity, I created a very basic web component that displays a button, and when clicked, shows an alert. The code for the web component looks like this:

class CustomAlertButton extends HTMLElement {

    static get observedAttributes() {
        return [
            "text",
            "message"
        ]
    }

    attributeChangedCallback(name, oldValue, newValue) {
        this.render()
    }

    constructor() {
        super()

        /**
         * Sets the button's text.
         * @default "Show Alert"
         * @public
         */
        this.text = "Show Alert"

        /**
         * Sets the alert message.
         * @default ""
         * @public
         */
        this.message = ""

        this.attachShadow({ mode: "open" })
        this.render()
    }

    render() {
        const text = this.getAttribute("text") || this.text
        const message = this.getAttribute("message") || this.message
        let button
        if (!this.shadowRoot.querySelector("button")) {
            button = document.createElement("button")
            this.shadowRoot.appendChild(button)
        } else {
            button = this.shadowRoot.querySelector("button")
            button.textContent = text
            if (message) {
                button.addEventListener("click", async () => {
                    alert(message)
                })
            }
        }
    }
}

customElements.define("custom-alert-button", CustomAlertButton)

There are two things important to note regarding the implementation above:

  1. For some reason I don't fully understand yet, the render method of the web component will get executed three times when the component is first rendered in a UI5 application. Therefore, the method includes some conditional logic to avoid adding multiple buttons or event handlers to the shadow DOM.
  2. The static getter observedAttributes as well as the JSDoc comments in the constructor method are mandatory in order for UI5 to be able to recognize the web component correctly and integrate it into its data binding and property system. Furthermore, we have to generate a custom-elements.js manifest file that describes the web component's API. This can be done using the @custom-elements-manifest/analyzer package. After installing it as a dev dependency, you can run the following command to generate the manifest file:
custom-elements-manifest analyze

This will create a custom-elements.json file in the root of your project. The file tree of your custom web component package should now look like this:

custom-webc-package/
|-- custom-elements.js
|-- CustomAlertButton.js
|-- package.json

With the custom web component package ready, we can now consume it in a UI5 application. To do so, we first need to install it as a dependency. In the package.json of the UI5 application, add it as a dependency and run npm install afterwards:

...
{
  "dependencies": {
    "custom-webc-package": "file:<path-to-your-custom-webc-package>"
  }
}
...

At this point you might be thinking "wait, I can just declare any package as a dependency and use it in UI5?!" - and the answer is yes, with the help of the ui5-tooling-modules package, which allows you to consume arbitrary npm packages in UI5 applications. So make sure you have it set up in your UI5 application.

Now that the custom web component package is installed, its consumption is very straightforward. Simply declare a namespace in an XML view that points to the package, and use the web component like any other UI5 control:

<mvc:View
    ...
    xmlns:webc="custom-webc-package">
    ...
    <webc:custom-alert-button
        text="Click Me!"
        message="Hello from my custom web component!" />
    ...

Now, to top off this exmaple, one more thing worth mentioning: In our web component implementation, we can even import and use other web components, for example UI5 web components. The UI5 web components have the same look and feel as the standard UI5 controls, but they are built on top of web component technologies, so they too are framework-agnostic (just like our own custom web component). In our example, we can replace the standard HTML button with the ui5-button web component from the UI5 web components library:

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Button.js"

class CustomAlertButton extends HTMLElement {

    ...

    render() {
        const text = this.getAttribute("text") || this.text
        const message = this.getAttribute("message") || this.message
        let button
        if (!this.shadowRoot.querySelector("ui5-button")) {
            button = document.createElement("ui5-button")
            this.shadowRoot.appendChild(button)
        } else {
            button = this.shadowRoot.querySelector("ui5-button")
            button.textContent = text
            if (message) {
                button.addEventListener("click", async () => {
                    alert(message)
                })
            }
        }
    }
}

customElements.define("custom-alert-button", CustomAlertButton)

We have now come full-circle: We created a custom web component, which by design is framework-agnostic, and used a UI5 web component inside of it. We consumed the custom web component in a UI5 application, demonstrating the flexibility and openness of the UI5 framework, and we could take this same web component to any other application as well, be it UI5 or not.

Try it out yourself and let me know how it goes!

entry.title: Re: 2H2025 - Introducing Public Content Links: Seamless Static Content Hosting in SuccessFactors

@Tanzil 

  • Email notifications must be enabled for the administrator uploading the file. If email is disabled, the public link appears only once in the confirmation dialog and can't be retrieved later. To ensure emails are enabled:
    • Go to Admin Center > Change User Email Notification and verify that Email Notification is enabled for the user.
    • Additionally, the user must enable the Settings (under their profile icon) > Notifications > Send emails to me setting.

entry.title: Re: Use Datastore to avoid too many duplicate MPL attachments in exception retries
entry.content:
In those scenarios, you can still have automatic retries from the DLQ DataStore pushed to the original queue, but with less frequent retry intervals to avoid overloading the system (as a good alternative to JMS exponential backoff). 

On the other hand, there are no hard limits for MPL attachments in Cloud Foundry (number, size of single attachment, not using tenant DB size but BTP object store) as per note: 3380591. Anyway, saving attachments to DataStore can help smooth out the process and is definitely worth considering if you chose unlimited/high number of retries.

For downtime handling, this blog is quite useful
https://community.sap.com/t5/integration-blog-posts/add-sap-pi-po-communication-channel-start-stop-functionality-to-your-iflows/ba-p/14115643

although it's only a workaround - standard start/stop feature like in PI/PO is unfortunately still missing.

 

br

Mateusz

entry.title: How to Create a Generic Business Partner
entry.content:
How to mass create a generic Business Partner with either Business Partner applications or via the Migration Cockpit without any specific customer/supplier role. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to Create a Generic Business Partner
entry.content:
Hi, 

 

It is not possible to create a generic business partner via the Migration Cockpit app either by the Staging Table approach or Direct Transfer as the business partner must have a role. This is clearly defined in the Help Portal for both approaches-

  • Business partner | SAP Help Portal - Direct Transfer
  • Customer | SAP Help Portal - Staging Table
  • Supplier | SAP Help Portal - Staging Table

 

The 'Manage Mass Maintenance ‚Äì Business Partner' application can be used to update a preexisting Business Partner but it cannot be used to create a Business Partner. More information is available here: Creating and Editing a Mass Process | SAP Help Portal. 

 

In order to create a generic Business Partner please use the 'Manage Business Partners' application for individual Business Partners. More information is available here: Creating a Business Partner | SAP Help Portal .

 

If you wish to mass create Business Partners please use this documentation: Business Partner Integration | SAP Help Portal.

 

Thanks, 

SAP Support
